item.description:
February's book will be "A History of God: The 4,000 Year Quest of Judaism, Christianity, and Islam", by Karen Armstrong.

Karen Armstrong weaves the story from ancient civilization to the enlightenment on the history of the God we hear about today - in the making. Drawing upon multiple sources, including the texts themselves, Armstrong makes the compelling case that the development of theological doctrines that surround God have been an integral part of a social-political process that enveloped civilization as humanity began questioning and exploring the world around them. Mystical unexplained forces that were once attributed to the supernatural have slowly been replaced by the discovery of natural laws. This journey has shaped the development of religions themselves and has pushed God further away from the natural world and further into the recesses of our lives - a personal God. Armstrong places perspective on religion and asks the fundemental question of our time: Does God have a future?
